info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:20PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Denver and western Adams Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 319 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Commerce City, or 9 miles northeast of Denver, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Denver, northern Aurora, Commerce City, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses and Bennett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.
